segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and it’s making me so frustrated.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying that plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t noticed the puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and she’s completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like screaming at her to turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the water is going to make it even worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to notice the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little sorry for her, she’s so out of touch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that faucet before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
